Bayern Munich have been dealt a blow ahead of Wednesday's Champions League clash with Arsenal after Xabi Alonso limped out of training. 
The Spaniard, who is a key member of Carlo Ancelotti 's squad, was unable to complete Monday's session and left the pitch clearly in pain according to German newspaper Bild . 
A golf buggy was needed to take the former Liverpool player away for treatment on what looked to be a knee problem. 
Alonso has featured 23 times for Bayern this season, including three Champions League games, scoring three times for the Bundesliga outfit. Jerome Boateng will miss Wednesday's clash with Arsenal despite training (Photo: Getty) Robert Lewandowski reacts during Monday's session (Photo: Getty) Read More 
Alonso would join Frank Ribery and central defender Jerome Boateng in missing Wednesday's clash at the Alianz Arena should his injury prove deem him unavailable.
